message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We used longitudinal data from the Egypt Labor Market Panel Survey and combined it with company-level information on workplace practices.", "dataset": ["Egypt Labor Market Panel Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes a new hand-collected dataset on the names of corporate bond funds to assess how institutional investors influence the regulatory landscape.", "dataset": ["hand-collected dataset on the names of corporate bond funds"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using both administrative and survey data, we evaluate the impacts of Bolivia's Rural Electrification Program on electrification rates and electrified households’ consumption patterns.", "dataset": ["administrative data", "survey data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a unique dataset drawing on satellite imagery and ground-based measurements to quantify emissions in key Brazilian municipalities.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "ground-based measurements"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis combines data from a household survey conducted in Bangladesh and remotely sensed nighttime light data.", "dataset": ["household survey conducted in Bangladesh", "remotely sensed nighttime light data"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To understand these changes, our analysis draws on a new dataset on drone companies operating in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["new dataset on drone companies operating in sub-Saharan Africa"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper evaluates the effects of India’s large-scale rural road construction program on agricultural sales and employment, using spatial data on road construction and geocoded data on market locations.", "dataset": ["spatial data on road construction", "geocoded data on market locations"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit a novel geocoded dataset on the distribution of Egyptian voters to show that ballots transferred within a coalition were more likely to benefit from electoral protection than ballots that moved between parties.", "dataset": ["geocoded dataset on the distribution of Egyptian voters"], "topic": ["Governance", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "By matching geographic information on Chinese firms with comprehensive trade transaction data, we quantify the effects of natural disasters on firm-level trade bio-diversification and product quality upgrading in affected regions.", "dataset": ["geographic information on Chinese firms", "comprehensive trade transaction data"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management ", "Extractive Industries", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Our approach combines household survey and census data through a hierarchical Bayesian model to estimate changes in mortality rates for children under-five across life-saving interventions and environmental factors over time and space at sub-national levels in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "census data"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}]
